summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas. The email outlines operational planning, coordination with prosecutors, and references the prior search of Epstein's NYC residence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the planned search warrant for his private island near St. Thomas. The email references his previous NYC residence search.

events.title: Planning discussion for island search
events.description: FBI personnel discussed planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island.

events.title: Search of Epstein's NYC residence
events.description: The FBI executed a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence, initially for pictures and proof of residency, but expanded to a full search after observing evidence. They took 845 pictures over 13 hours.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's island
events.description: The FBI is planning to execute a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas within the next 30 days, contingent on securing probable cause.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's island near St. Thomas
keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning a search warrant execution for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas in late July 2019.
The search of Epstein's NYC residence resulted in 845 photographs taken over 13 hours, after initial scope was expanded due to observations at the scene.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) preferred to isolate the 2019 case from the investigation that occurred approximately 12 years prior.
The email indicates operational coordination between FBI field offices and discussions with Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) regarding the warrant.
The island was estimated via Google images to have between 15-20 buildings.
